words.definition: A bath is water in a tub. People take a bath to get clean.
words.example: After playing in the dirt, the boy took a bath.

words.definition: To bend is to move something so it is not straight.
words.example: Lee bent over to pick up the paper.

words.definition: To chew is to move your mouth to break up food.
words.example: I chewed my food carefully before swallowing it.

words.definition: When a person is disabled, they cannot do what a normal person can do.
words.example: The disabled man used a wheelchair to get around.

words.definition: If something is fantastic, it is very good.
words.example: The weather was fantastic, so we went to the beach.

words.definition: Fiction is a story that is not true.
words.example: I enjoy reading works of fiction because they are very creative.

words.definition: A flag is a piece of colored cloth that represents something.
words.example: Our country has a beautiful flag.

words.definition: To inspect is to look at something carefully.
words.example: The boy inspected the coin he found on the ground.

words.definition: A journal is a type of magazine that comes out regularly.
words.example: He publishes his work in a medical journal.

words.definition: A liquid is a substance that is neither solid nor gas.
words.example: Water is the most important liquid for life.

words.definition: To marvel at something is to feel surprise and interest in it.
words.example: We marveled at the beautiful sunset.

words.definition: A nutrient is something that a living thing needs to keep it alive.
words.example: Vegetables are full of important nutrients.

words.definition: To overcome a problem is to successfully fix it.
words.example: She overcame her fear of heights.

words.definition: To recall something is to remember it.
words.example: She was unable to recall what happened in the accident.

words.definition: To regret is to feel sorry about something you did.
words.example: I regret that I didn't study harder for the test.

words.definition: A soul is a personâ€™s spirit.
words.example: Some people believe that the soul lives on after the body dies.

words.definition: When something is sufficient, it is enough.
words.example: The teacher gave the students sufficient time to finish the test.

words.definition: Surgery is medical treatment in which a doctor cuts the body.
words.example: He needed surgery on his knee.

words.definition: If something is tough, it is hard or strong.
words.example: The exam was very tough.

words.definition: A tube is a pipe through which water or air passes.
words.example: The water pipe was made from a metal tube.
